Package View

Class MineSweeper

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
View.MineSweeper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class MineSweeper extends javafx.application.Application implements Observer
This class is a graphical user interface for a game of Minesweeper. The playing field is a grid of hexagonal tiles in the middle of the screen that can be clicked to reveal or flag them, while a row of buttons beneath it controls saving, loading, pausing, and starting a new game. Meanwhile, a scoreboard on the left side displays the top times for the current difficulty setting, and labels above the playing field show the time spent on the current game and the number of flags and mines.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    private static class 
    MineSweeper.Hexagon
    This inner class creates a hexagon which can be places on the board with an x and y position We calculate this x and y position inside the addHex method This generates a new polygon with the needed hex points

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method, called on program startup. It allocates colors to adjacent-mine counts before starting up the view.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Runs upon launch. It fills out and then creates the main window of the game, before prompting the user to select a difficulty for their first game.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application

    • createScene

      private javafx.scene.Scene createScene()
      Sets up the basic structure of the game screen, including the buttons, timer, and their relative locations in the panes.

    • generateConstants

      private void generateConstants(int rows, int cols)
      Adjusts constants in the program based on the size of the game board, in order to rescale the board so it fits on screen.
      Parameters:
      rows - The size of the game board, in rows.
      cols - The size of the game board, in columns.

    • createController

      private void createController(String difficulty)
      Creates a new controller with the chosen difficulty, then sets up the display with it.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - The string for the difficulty of game to set up.

    • createController

      private void createController(File file) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Creates a controller from a loaded file, which entails updating the board after setting up the display.
      Parameters:
      file - The file to load the game from.
      Throws:
      IOException - If file loading fails.
      ClassNotFoundException - If a MineSweeperTile[][] could not be loaded from the file information.

    • createDisplayFromController

      private void createDisplayFromController()
      Uses the information in the controller (namely the size of the board) to create an initial grid of hexagons of that size. This method also sets the current view to be the observer for the controller's stored model.

      private void animateBombs(int row, int col)
      Animates the reveal of a bomb tile by scaling and spinning it.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the bomb to animate.
      col - The column of the bomb to animate.

    • animateTiles

      private void animateTiles(int row, int col)
      Animates the reveal of a tile by scaling it up and down in a "popping" motion.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the tile to animate.
      col - The column of the tile to animate.

    • setBoardOpacity

      private void setBoardOpacity(double opacity)
      Sets every hexagon's opacity to the value given in the arguments
      Parameters:
      opacity - the opacity to set each hexagon to, 0.0 being translucent, and 1.0 being fully opaque

    • setBoardDisabled

      private void setBoardDisabled(boolean disabled)
      Sets every hexagon and label to be disabled or enabled, true being disabled
      Parameters:
      disabled - True if elements are desired to be disabled

    • update

      public void update(Observable o, Object arg)
      Updates the view with the new board state, including calling game-over messages if the game has ended.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - the model
      arg - the MineSweeperTile[][] board from the model
